titleInfo.title: Distribution of base prisoner of war camps and general hospitals with prisoners of war as of 11 October 1944

mods.abstract: Map depicting the prisoner of war camps in the United States as of October 11, 1944. The legend differentiates between base camps and general hospitals.

Harry Elliott Dudley was born in Corpus Christi, Texas, on July 27, 1895. During World War I he served as sergeant in the United States Marine Corps at its Noncommissioned Officers School at Parris Island, South Carolina. During the interbellum period, Dudley held a number of jobs including a teaching position at the Augusta Military Academy and a brief stint in minor league baseball. He joined the National Guard in 1924. In 1940, his unit was called into active service. From December 1941 until January 1943, he served as Post Inspector and Liaison Officer at Fort Ord. In January 1943, he was transferred to the Office of the Provost Marshal General, which administered internment camps for enemy prisoners of war. In March 1943, he was assigned to the internment camp in Crossville, Tennessee, and eventually made its commanding officer. Dudley retired from the Army in 1954 and died in Sikeston, Missouri, in 1967.
